did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Lewis Lawrence Smith papers (series 77)

bioghist.p: Lewis Lawrence Smith (1864-1931), the son of A. Lewis and Rebecca Levis Wood Smith, was a prominent Philadelphia attorney. Smith graduated from the University of Pennsylvania with an A.B. degree in 1884. In 1888 he was awarded a Master of Arts degree. Smith served as general counsel for the Lansdowne Bank & Trust Co., First National Bank of Darby, and the Drexel Hill Title & Trust Co. He also held memberships in the University Club, Historical Society of Pennsylvania, Delaware County Historical Society, Delaware County Institute of Science, and the State Bar Association. In 1892 Smith married Gertrude Gouverneur Clemson (1867-1947), the daughter of the Rev. Thomas Green Clemson (1833-1888) and Sarah Frances Ogden (1833-1910?). The couple had three sons: Lewis Gouverneur (1893-1919), Ludlow Ogden (b. 1899), and Lawrence Meredith Clemson (1902-1975).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Lewis Lawrence Smith. Materials include: correspondence; legal case file documents; stock certificates; receipts and bills; photographs; scrapbooks and newspaper clippings; and invitations and programs. The collection also includes materials related to Gertrude Gouverneur Clemson Smith, A. Lewis Smith, and Lawarence M.C. Smith.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
